dialogue.name: Mom
dialogue.text: Noah, son, did you prepare everything for tomorrow?

dialogue.name: Mom
dialogue.text: Did you finish your homework? And did you hang up your clothes?

dialogue.name: Noah
dialogue.text: Yeah, Mom, everything’s done, don’t worry.
I bit into the apple so eagerly that my jaw almost cramped.
I carefully pulled the apple out of my mouth and saw a tooth stuck in it — the one that had been wiggling all week.

dialogue.name: Mom
dialogue.text: Oh, that’s great! Put it under your pillow, and by morning the Tooth Fairy will leave some money for you!

dialogue.name: Noah
dialogue.text: Mom, that’s not a fairy! Mike told me his mom put it there...

dialogue.name: Noah
dialogue.text: ...and now the fairy doesn’t visit him anymore...

dialogue.name: Mom
dialogue.text: It’s simple — he stopped believing in her, that’s why she doesn’t come.

dialogue.name: Mom
dialogue.text: If yes, then go brush your teeth and head to your room — it’s almost bedtime.

dialogue.name: Noah
dialogue.text: Okaaaay. Thanks for the food, love you!
